name: skimpily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If you are skimpily dressed, your clothing shows a lot of your body: skimpily dressed The use of skimpily dressed women in advertising stereotypes women.skimpily clad Inside the hall, there are several groups of skimpily clad dancers. They were both dressed skimpily in shorts and T-shirts.
disapproving in a way that is not enough or not large enough: They cut material so skimpily that many women have to go up a size to find anything that fits. The room itself was skimpily furnished.
More examplesFewer examplesThey dress skimpily the rest of the year, but in winter they like boots and thick sweaters. The camera focused on a rather skimpily dressed woman who was yawning in the crowd.Two other artists are represented too skimpily to add much to the show.The apartment had a smart, but skimpily equipped kitchen.
